ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Have you seen a provider (e.g. doctor) in the office?
Seen a provider in the office - How many times?
Seen a provider in the office - Were the visits related to your low back pain?
Have you seen a doctor in the emergency room?
Seen a doctor in the emergency room - How many times?
Seen a doctor in the emergency room - Were the visits related to your low back pain?
Seen a doctor in the emergency room - How many were because of your low back pain?
Have you seen a doctor in urgent care?
Seen a doctor in urgent care - How many times?
Were the urgent care visit(s) related to your low back pain?
Seen a doctor in urgent care - How many were because of your low back pain?
Have you stayed at least overnight in a hospital?
Stayed at least overnight in a hospital - How many times?
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Cardiac (heart attack, angina, chest pain, congestive heart failure, etc.)
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Infection (pneumonia, urinary tract infection, cellulitis, etc)
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Pulmonary (asthma, emphysema, bronchitis, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, etc)
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Cancer
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Diabetes
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Stroke
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Hip fracture
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Arthritis (spinal stenosis, compression fracture, gout, rheumatoid arthritis, etc)
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Gastrointestinal hemorrhage (upper or lower)
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Dehydration
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Peripheral artery disease (claudication, amputation, bypass surgery, etc)
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Other, Medical
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Other, Surgical
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Other, Psychiatric
What was the reason(s) for your hospitalization? Other, Other
Have you been a patient in a nursing home?
Have you had an MRI or CAT scan of your low back?
MRI or CAT scan of your low back - Which type?
Have you had an injection to your lower back?
Have you had surgery to your lower back?
Have you gone to physical therapy?
Have you had acupuncture treatment(s) for your back pain?
Have you had chiropractic treatment(s) for your back pain?
Have you had massage treatment(s) for your back pain?
Have you been prescribed a new  pain medication or started taking any over-the-counter pain medications regularly?
Have you stopped any prescription or over-the-counter pain medications?
